DataElement.preferredName: Internal Radiation Therapy Stranded Seed Implant Total Administration Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The total dose of radiation administered as a brachytherapy seed implant represented as a numeric value.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Domain Internal Radiation Therapy Stranded Seed Implant Total Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure._A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor._An implant consisting of multiple radioactive pellets linked together._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Property.preferredName: Internal Radiation Therapy Stranded Seed Implant Total Administration
Property.preferredDefinition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor.:An implant consisting of multiple radioactive pellets linked together.:Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Concepts.definition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.
An implant consisting of multiple radioactive pellets linked together.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
